====================
 Batteries Included
====================

The `list of modules`_ that comes with Erlang is extensive. It can be hard for
a new user of Erlang to know how to approach this list.

This is a break down of modules you will most likely make use of.

Data Structures
===============

`lists <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/lists.html>`_
   Manipulate Erlang lists, commonly used higher order functions

`proplists <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/proplists.html>`_
   Manipulate lists of "property" values

`dict <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/dict.html>`_
   Key/value dictionary

`sets <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/sets.html>`_
   Collection of unique elements

`queue <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/queue.html>`_
   FIFO queues

`orddict <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/orddict.html>`_
   Ordered dictionaries

`ordsets <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/ordsets.html>`_
   Ordered sets

`string <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/string.html>`_
   String manipulation

`unicode <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/unicode.html>`_
   Unicode manipulation

Data Storage and Retrieval
==========================

`ets <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/ets.html>`_
   In memory Erlang term storage

`dets <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/dets.html>`_
   On disk Erlang term storage

Files
=====

`file <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/file.html>`_
   Higher level file operations

`filelib <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/dets.html>`_
   Lower level file operations

`filename <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/dets.html>`_
   File name manipulation

Date/Time
=========

`calendar <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/calendar.html>`_
   Miscellaneous date and time functions

Networking
==========

`inet <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/inet.html>`_
   Various TCP/IP functions

`gen_tcp <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/gen_tcp.html>`_
   Interface to TCP/IP sockets

`gen_udp <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/gen_udp.html>`_
   Interface to UDP sockets

`gen_sctp <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/gen_sctp.html>`_
   Interface to SCTP sockets

General IO
==========

`io <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/io.html>`_
   IO server functions

`io_lib <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/io_lib.html>`_
   IO library functions

Regular Expressions
===================

`re <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/re.html>`_
   Regular expression support

Erlang System
=============

`erlang <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/erlang.html>`_
   Erlang BIFs (built in functions)

`sys <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/sys.html>`_
   Interface to Erlang system messages

`init <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/init.html>`_
   Coodination of Erlang system startup

Operating System
================

`os <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/application.html>`_
   Operating system functions

File Archives and Compression
=============================

`zip <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/zip.html>`_
   Read and create zip archives

`zlib <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/zlib.html>`_
   ZLIB compression support

Hash Digests and Cryptography
=============================

`base64 <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/base64.html>`_
   base64 encoding and decoding

`crypto <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/crypto.html>`_
   Cryptographic functions

General Computation
===================

`math <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/math.html>`_
   Common mathematical functions

`random <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/random.html>`_
   Pseudo random number generation

Testing
=======

`eunit <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/eunit.html>`_
   EUnit support

`ct <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/ct.html>`_
   Common Test support

Debugging
=========

`dbg <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/dbg.html>`_
   Text based tracing

`debugger <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/debugger.html>`_
   Graphical debugger

Developer Utilities
===================

`edoc <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/edoc.html>`_
   Documentation generator

`cover <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/cover.html>`_
   Coverage analysis

`cprof <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/cprof.html>`_
   Call count profiling tool

`fprof <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/fprof.html>`_
   Time profiling tool

`dialyzer <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/dialyzer.html>`_
   Discrepancy analysis tool

Internet
========

`ftp <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/ftp.html>`_
   FTP client

`httpc <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/httpc.html>`_
   HTTP client

`httpd <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/httpd.html>`_
   HTTP server

OTP
===

`application <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/application.html>`_
   OTP application functions

`proc_lib <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/proc_lib.html>`_
   Lowed level OTP support

`gen_server <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/gen_server.html>`_
   High level OTP interface for Erlang processes

`supervisor <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/supervisor.html>`_
   Supervise other OTP processes

`gen_event <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/gen_event.html>`_
   Extensible OTP interface for Erlang processes

`gen_fsm <http://www.erlang.org/doc/man/gen_fsm.html>`_
   OTP interface for finite state machines

.. _list of modules: http://www.erlang.org/doc/man_index.html
